include.name: Harvey Weinstein
include.title: Hollywood producer
include.accusation: More than 50 women have leveled accusations against him, including rape, sexual assault, and sexual harassment
include.result: Dropped from his film studio and under investigation by authorities in NY and LA.

include.name: Andy Signore
include.title: Media executive
include.accusation: Accused of harassment by several women, and attempted assault by one.

include.name: Ben Affleck
include.title: Hollywood actor
include.accusation: Multiple women accused the actor of inappropriate touching and harassment.
include.result: Apologized to Hilarie Burton via Twitter.

include.name: Roy Price
include.title: Amazon Studios president
include.accusation: Accused of sexually harassing a producer of "The Man in the High Castle."

include.name: Oliver Stone
include.title: Hollywood filmmaker
include.accusation: Accused of groping a woman, and embarassing another women in a "horrid" audition.
include.result: Stone denied wrongdoing in the audition, and hasn't spoken on the groping.

include.name: Bob Weinstein
include.title: Hollywood producer
include.accusation: Executive producer of "The Mist" accused him of harassment.

include.name: Lockhart Steele
include.title: Vox Media editorial director
include.accusation: Eden Rohatensky, a former Vox web developer, accused "one of the company's VPs" of sexual misconduct. Vox said Steele, their editorial director,admitted to it.")

include.name: Robert Scoble
include.title: Tech blogger
include.accusation: Accused by multiple women of sexual misconduct.

include.name: David Blaine
include.title: Magician
include.accusation: Accused by one woman of rape, and another for sexual assault.

include.name: Gilbert Rozon
include.title: Comedy festival founder
include.accusation: Several women accuse Rozon of sexual misconduct and aggression.
include.result: Rozon steps down as head of the Just for Laughs festival.

include.name: Chris Savino
include.title: Television show creator
include.accusation: At least 12 women allege sexual harassment and inappropriate behavior.

include.name: Twiggy Ramirez
include.title: Bassist and guitarist for Marilyn Manson
include.accusation: Accused of rape and abuse by former girlfriend, Jessicka Adams.

include.name: Zain Jaffer
include.title: CEO of the startup, Vungle
include.accusation: Arrested for assaulting and sexually abusing his 3-year-old son.
include.result: Fired, charged with several felony counts.

include.name: James Toback
include.title: Director
include.accusation: Accused by more than 300 women for sexual harassment.
include.result: Toback denied the allegations to the L.A. Times.

include.name: Terry Richardson
include.title: Fashion photographer
include.accusation: Accused of sexual misconduct and sexual exploitation of models.
include.result: Denied the allegations, was dropped by Condé Nast International.

include.name: Leon Wieseltier
include.title: Former literary editor at The New Republic
include.accusation: Several former New Republic employees allege sexual harassment.
include.result: Backers pulled the plug on his new magazine.

include.name: Ethan Kath
include.title: Co-founder of the band Crystal Castles
include.accusation: Former singer, Alice Glass, accused him of rape and abuse.

include.name: Knight Landesman
include.title: Publisher of Artforum magazine
include.accusation: Sued by at least 9 women for sexual harassment.

include.name: George H.W. Bush
include.title: 41st President of the United States
include.accusation: Accused of inappropriate touching by several women.

include.name: Mark Halperin
include.title: Political journalist, "Game Change" co-author
include.accusation: Accused of sexual harassment while political director of ABC News by 5 women.
include.result: Dropped by NBC and MSNBC, book deal cancelled, HBO miniseries scrapped.

include.name: John Besh
include.title: Chef
include.accusation: 25 women alleged that the chef fostered a culture of sexual harassment.

include.name: Ken Baker
include.title: Senior E! News correspondent
include.accusation: 2 women allege sexual harassment.

include.name: Rick Najera
include.title: Writer and producer
include.accusation: Accused of making inappropriate comments.

include.name: Kirt Webster
include.title: Country music producer
include.accusation: Several men accused the country music producer of sexual assault and harassment.
include.result: Dropped by famous clients and his namesake PR firm, which changed its name

include.name: Kevin Spacey
include.title: House of Cards star
include.accusation: Multple men accused the House of Cards star of making unwanted sexual advances.
include.result: Dropped by House of Cards, replaced in upcoming film he already completed.

include.name: Michael Fallon
include.title: U.K. Defense Minister
include.accusation: A British journalist accused him of inappropriately touching her knee.

include.name: Jeremy Piven
include.title: Entourage star
include.accusation: 3 women accused the Entourage star of sexual assault.
include.result: His pre-taped interview with Stephen Colbert was pulled.

include.name: Hamilton Fish
include.title: Publisher and President of New Republic
include.accusation: Accused of several woman for inappropriate behavior and touching.

include.name: Michael Oreskes
include.title: Senior Vice President of News at NPR
include.accusation: 2 women accused the NPR news chief of unwanted physical contact.

include.name: Andy Dick
include.title: Comedian and actor
include.accusation: Multiple accusations of groping, unwanted kissing, licking, and sexual propositions.

include.name: Brett Ratner
include.title: Hollywood filmmaker
include.accusation: 6 accusations of sexual assault and misconduct.

include.name: Dustin Hoffman
include.title: Oscar winning actor
include.accusation: Accused of groping one woman and sexually harassing another.

include.name: Jeff Hoover
include.title: Kentucky House Speaker
include.accusation: Former staffer alleged sexual harassment, which he settled.

include.name: Danny Jordaan
include.news_outlet: Jennifer Ferguson via Facebook and personal website
include.title: President of South African Football Association
include.accusation: Former member of parliament in the ANC accused him of rape.

include.name: Nick Carter
include.news_outlet: Melissa Schuman via her personal blog
include.title: Singer in the Backstreet Boys.
include.accusation: Accused of raping Melissa Schuman.

include.name: David Guillod
include.title: CEO of Primary Wave Entertainment.
include.accusation: Actress accused him of drugging and sexually assaulting her.

include.name: Jack Latvala
include.title: Florida Senate budget chair
include.accusation: Allegedly sexually harassed a senate aide.
include.result: Denied the allegations, is being urged by colleagues to resign.

include.name: Ed Westwick
include.title: Gossip Girl star
include.accusation: 2 women allege rape.
include.result: He said he's cooperating with authorities to be exonerated

include.name: Alex Gilady
include.title: President of Israelie broadcasting company
include.accusation: 2 allegations of inappropriate advances, and three allegations of rape.
include.result: Denied the allegations, but is stepping down.

include.name: Jeffrey Tambor
include.title: Hollywood actor
include.accusation: 2 "Transparent" coworkers accused him of sexual harassment.

include.name: Benjamin Genocchio
include.title: Art critic and major art fair director
include.accusation: 8 women allege inappropriate comments, 5 allege unwanted touching.
include.result: Replaced as executive director of the Armory Show.

include.name: Steven Seagal
include.title: Actor
include.accusation: Multiple allegations of sexual harassment.

include.name: Robert Knepper
include.title: Prison Break star
include.accusation: 5 allegations of sexual assault

include.name: Roy Moore
include.title: GOP nominee for Alabama U.S. Senate seat
include.accusation: 9 accusations including sexual harassment and abuse.
include.result: He has denied the allegations, and lost the election.

include.name: Louis C.K.
include.title: Comedian and actor
include.accusation: 5 women accused the comedian of sexual misconduct.

include.name: Matthew Weiner
include.title: Mad Men creator
include.accusation: Accused of sexual harassment by a former writer on Mad Men.

include.name: André Balazs
include.title: Celebrity hotelier
include.accusation: Several accusations of groping women.
include.result: He has not yet spoken out about the allegations.

include.name: Eddie Berganza
include.title: DC Comics editor
include.accusation: Accused by 2 coworkers of sexual assault.

include.name: Andrew Kreisberg
include.title: TV producer
include.accusation: 15 women and 4 men allege harassment and inappropriate contact.
include.result: Fired by Warner Bros. TV Group

include.name: George Takei
include.title: Star Trek star
include.accusation: Accused of sexual assault by former male model.

include.name: Gary Goddard
include.title: Hollywood director and producer
include.accusation: Two men accused him of assaulting them when they were underage.

include.name: Peter Aalbaek Jensen
include.title: Danish film producer
include.accusation: 9 women allege sexual misconduct, harassment, and bullying in the workplace.

include.name: Richard Dreyfuss
include.title: Hollywood actor
include.accusation: Former coworker accused him of harassment and exposing himself to her.

include.name: Sepp Blatter
include.title: Former FIFA President
include.accusation: Hope Solo accused him of groping her.

include.name: Mark Schwahn
include.title: One Tree Hill creator and showrunner
include.accusation: Accused by dozens of female cast and crew members of sexual harassment.
include.result: Schwahn was suspended and is being investigated.

include.name: Tom Sizemore
include.title: Hollywood actor
include.accusation: Accused of molesting an 11-year-old girl in 2003.

include.name: Giuseppe Castellano
include.title: Exec. art director at Penguin Random House
include.accusation: Accused of sexual harassment.

include.name: Andy Henry
include.title: Casting director
include.accusation: 5 women accused him of pressuring them to disrobe at audition classes.
include.result: Fired from CSI in 2008, went on to work on several other films.

include.name: Al Franken
include.title: U.S. Senator
include.accusation: 8 women accused Franken of sexual misconduct.

include.name: Matt Zimmerman
include.title: Senior VP of NBC News Talent Booking
include.accusation: Reportedly pursued inappropriate relationships with coworkers and sent inappropriate texts.

include.name: Stephen Bittel
include.title: Florida Democratic Party Chairman
include.accusation: 6 former staffers accused him of sexual harassment.

include.name: Russell Simmons
include.title: Co-founder of music label Def Jam Recordings
include.accusation: Accused by three women of rape, and two of sexual assault.
include.result: Simmons denied everything, stepped down from his companies.

include.name: Charlie Rose
include.title: Host of PBS' "Charlie Rose," and co-host of "CBS This Morning"
include.accusation: A total of 11 women have accused Rose of sexual misconduct.
include.result: Rose was dropped by CBS, PBS, and Bloomberg TV.

include.name: Glenn Thrush
include.title: NYT White House correspondent
include.accusation: 3 women accuse Thrush of making unwanted contact or advances.

include.name: John Conyers
include.title: U.S. Congressman
include.accusation: Former staffers accused him of harassment and unwanted touching.

include.name: John Lasseter
include.title: Head of Pixar and Walt Disney Animation
include.accusation: Accused by multiple women for unwanted touching.
include.result: Taking a 6 month sabbatical from Disney.

include.name: Richard Branson
include.title: Founder of the Virgin Group
include.accusation: Accused of sexually assaulting a woman in 2010.
include.result: Says he has no recollection of the event.

include.name: Garrison Keillor
include.title: Public radio personality
include.accusation: Multiple allegations of inappropriate behavior.

include.name: Johnny Iuzzini
include.title: Celebrity chef
include.accusation: 4 former employees accused him of sexual harassment and assault.

include.name: Matt Lauer
include.title: Today' anchor
include.accusation: 3 women accused him of sexual harassment and misconduct.

include.name: Israel Horovitz
include.title: Playwright
include.accusation: 9 accusations including rape, assault, or harassment.
include.result: Dropped by Gloucester Stage Company, which he co-founded.

include.name: Shervin Pishevar
include.title: Venture capitalist
include.accusation: 6 women accused him of sexual assault or harassment.
include.result: He left the firm he co-founded; denied allegations.

include.name: Blake Farenthold
include.title: U.S. Congressman
include.accusation: Settled a sexual harassment claim in 2014.
include.result: Under investigation from House Ethics Committee.

include.name: Dylan Howard
include.title: Top gossip magazine editor
include.accusation: Several accusations of harassment and inappropriate comments.
include.result: He told the AP the allegations were "baseless."

include.name: Trent Franks
include.title: U.S. Congressman
include.accusation: Accused of making unwanted advances towards female staffers.

include.name: Alex Kozinski
include.title: Judge for U.S. Court of Appeals for the 9th Circuit
include.accusation: At least 15 women accused him of sexual harassment.

include.name: Mario Batali
include.title: Chef
include.accusation: Four women allege inappropriate touching.
include.result: He's stepped away from his company and ABCs "The Chew."

include.name: Ryan Lizza
include.title: New Yorker politics reporter
include.accusation: Alleged "improper sexual misconduct."
include.result: Lizza denied the allegations, but was dropped by the New Yorker.

include.name: Tavis Smiley
include.title: PBS talk-show host
include.accusation: Multiple sexual msiconduct allegations.

include.name: Jerry Richardson
include.title: Carolina Panthers owner
include.accusation: At least 4 former employees have received settlements for "inappropriate workplace comments"
include.result: He is selling the team at the end of the 2017 season.

include.name: T.J. Miller
include.title: Silicon Valley actor
include.accusation: Accused of sexually assaulting and punching a woman while in college, and harassing another.
include.result: Denied the assault allegations, hasn't responded on the harassment.

include.name: Jordan Vogt-Roberts
include.title: Director
include.accusation: Adult film star accused him of forcefully kissing her, and harassing her with T.J. Miller

include.name: Andrea Ramsey
include.title: Kansas Democratic candidate
include.accusation: Accused of sexually harassing and then firing a male suboordinate.
include.result: She has dropped out of the race.

include.name: Mike Germano
include.title: Chief Digital Officer at Vice Media
include.accusation: Two women accused him of harassment.

include.name: Charlie Walk
include.title: President of Republic Records Group
include.accusation: Accused by three women of harassment.
include.result: Fired from the Fox network show The Four.

include.name: James Franco
include.title: Actor
include.accusation: Five women accuse Franco of inappropriate and exploitative sexual behavior.
include.result: He denied the allegations, and was removed from Vanity Fair's Hollywood cover.

include.name: Aziz Ansari
include.title: Commedian/Actor
include.accusation: Accused of sexual assaulting a woman he went on a date with.
include.result: He said he believed the encounter was consensual, and apologized at the time.

include.name: Michael Douglas
include.title: Actor
include.accusation: Writer Susan Braudy accused him of repeated sexual harassment.
include.result: He preemptively denied it before it was published.

include.name: Patrick Meehan
include.title: Congressman
include.accusation: Settled a sexual harassment claim last year with a former aide.
include.result: He is no longer running for re-election.

include.name: Robert Moore
include.title: Top editor at New York Daily News
include.accusation: Accused by several women of sexual harassment.

include.name: David Copperfield
include.title: Magician
include.accusation: A woman says he drugged and assaulted her when she was 17.
include.result: He denied the allegations in a statement.

include.name: Alexander "Doc" Jones
include.title: New York Daily News editor
include.accusation: Accused of forcefully kissing younger staffers.

include.name: Steve Wynn
include.title: Casino mogul
include.accusation: Dozens of women accuse him of decades of sexual misconduct.

include.name: Wayne Pacelle
include.title: Humane Society CEO
include.accusation: Three complaints of sexual harassment were filed against him.

include.name: Patrick Witty
include.title: National Geographic photo editor
include.accusation: Accused by several women of sexual misconduct and unwanted advances.
include.result: He was fired after an HR investigation.

include.name: Don Shooter
include.title: Republican Arizona State Congressman
include.accusation: Accused of sexual harassment and unwanted touching by several women.

include.name: Vincent Cirrincione
include.title: Hollywood manager
include.accusation: Several minority women accused him of sexual misconduct.
include.result: He denied seeking sexual favors for representation.
